alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:27AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Livingston and south central La Salle Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 126 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wenona to near Gridley to near Lexington. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. In addition, torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms. A rain gauge near Lexington has recorded nearly 2 inches of rain in the last 30 minutes. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pontiac, Chenoa, Gridley, Flanagan, Cornell, Rutland, Long Point, Dana and Weston. Including the following interstate... I-55 between mile markers 188 and 201. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
